intro: Hillia chiriquiensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí hillia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as montane forests and cloud forests. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms during the wet season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
